links.title: INES - Nesdev wiki
links.description: The .NES file format (file name suffix .nes) is the de facto standard for distribution of NES binary programs, with use even in licensed emulators such as commercialized PocketNES and Wii Virtual Console. It is often called the iNES format, as it was created by Marat Fayzullin for an emulator called iNES. A "rebooted" version of this file format, NES 2.0, was created to fix many shortcomings and support in emulators is being added.

His original purpose was to ferry passengers away from Lud and had stops in Candleton, Rilea, The Falls of the Hounds, Dasherville, and Topeka.

As an adjective, it is used with the meaning of "sexy", "dirty" or "naughty"; as a verb, ecchi o suru („Ç®„ÉÉ„ÉÅ„Çí„Åô„Çã), with the meaning to have sex; or as a noun, to describe someone of lascivious behavior.
